p.o: ... a man having room for but for one of his feet, he must climb up twelve or sixteen fathoms high. Then he comes to a place where, having but room for his left foot and left hand, he must leap from thence to another place before him which, if he hit right, the rest of the ascent is easier, and with a small cord which he carries with him he hales up a rope whereby all the rest came up. But if he misseth that footstep (as often times they do) he falls into the sea and the company takes him in by the small cord and he sits until he is a little refreshed and then he tries it again.
